item.title: Python Testing 201 with pytest
item.description:
Description

At the September 2019 Python Frederick event, Matt explored the features of pytest and how to apply them to Python.
item.dc:creator: Matt Layman

item.title: Using Git and GitHub to safely store your code
item.description:
Description

At Python Frederick for July 2019, I presented on the fundamentals of #Git and #GitHub for storing your code safely and sharing it with others. This talk is aimed at beginners with no prior knowledge of Git.
item.dc:creator: Matt Layman

item.title: Python Testing 101 with pytest
item.description:
Description

At the March 2019 Python Frederick event, Matt focused on the fundamentals of Python testing while using the pytest package.
item.dc:creator: Matt Layman

item.title: Anvil
item.description:
Description

Meredydd gave a talk about Anvil to Python Frederick, a Python user group in Frederick, MD. Thanks for joining us!
item.dc:creator: Meredydd Luff

item.title: Django Tutorial Adventure Part 2
item.description:
Description

At the December 2018 Python Frederick event, Patrick walked through the second half of the Django 2.1 tutorial. Since Patrick is a DevOps engineer instead of a web developer, the group got to share in the experience in a novice.

The Django tutorial is very large so we picked up from where we left off from the previous presentation. If you want to watch that experience, check out https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZSs2eZ-yFps
item.dc:creator: Patrick Pierson

item.title: Build Native Mobile Apps with Python and BeeWare
item.description:
Description

At the October 2018 Python Frederick event, Bob showed the group how we can build native mobile applications that are written completely in Python using the BeeWare suite of tools
item.dc:creator: Bob Marchese

item.title: Django Tutorial Adventure
item.description:
Description

At the August 2018 Python Frederick event, Patrick walked through the Django 2.1 tutorial. Since Patrick is a DevOps engineer instead of a web developer, the group got to share in the experience in a novice.

The Django tutorial is very large so we only managed to complete parts 1 and 2 of the tutorial.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Pierson

item.title: Python + Software Defined Radios
item.description:
Description

At the April 2018 Python Frederick presentation, Patrick Pierson talked about how to use Python with software defined radios.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Pierson

item.title: How we built pythonfrederick.org for 4Â¢ a day
item.description:
Description

At our March 2018 event, Matt Layman spoke to the group about how to build a portfolio website using Pelican and Netlify for the cost of a domain name.

The recording was interrupted when a display cable was pulled, but the first portion of the talk outlines most of the parts and process are included so we decided to publish it anyway.

Note: requirement.txt should have been requirements.txt (with an s character). This was an oversight and fixed later in the talk.
item.dc:creator: Matt Layman

item.title: Data science in Python
item.description:
Description

At the December 2017 Python Frederick meetup, Christine Lee provided an excellent overview of the Python data science ecosystem. There's a lot of info so the topics are listed below with their times.

  • Anaconda - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=236
  • NumPy - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=726
  • SymPy - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=1204
  • SciPy - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=1827
  • scikit-learn - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=2432
  • pandas - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=3385
  • matplotlib - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=3953
  • Bokey and Plotly - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=4458
  • Jupyter Notebooks - https://youtu.be/3kTOLVD0ZCg?t=5520
item.dc:creator: Christine Lee

item.title: Scaping the web with Scrapy
item.description:
Description

At the November 2017 Python Frederick presentation, Micah showed the group how to get data from web pages using Scrapy. He explained the core pieces needed to work with Scrapy and demonstrated the tool by building a project that scraped content from a sample website.
item.dc:creator: Micah Nordland

item.title: Python web frameworks shootout
item.description:
Description

At the October 2017 Python Frederick meetup, we looked at API Star, Falcon, Flask, Django, and Pyramid and did a comparison of their features to see which would be the best fit for your future web project.
item.dc:creator: Matt Layman

item.title: Pipfile and pipenv
item.description:
Description

At this Python Frederick talk, Matt Layman talked about Python's new Pipfile format and how it solves some of the package dependency management problems that Python applications face.
item.dc:creator: Matt Layman
